timeSeriesQuery.timeSeriesQueryLanguage:
fetch cloud_dataproc_cluster
| metric 'dataproc.googleapis.com/cluster/job/running_count'
| group_by 1m, [value_running_count_aggregate: aggregate(value.running_count)]
| every 1m
| group_by [resource.project_id],
    [value_running_count_aggregate_aggregate:
       aggregate(value_running_count_aggregate)]

fetch cloud_dataproc_cluster
| metric 'dataproc.googleapis.com/cluster/job/failed_count'
| align delta(1m)
| every 1m
| group_by [resource.project_id],
    [value_failed_count_aggregate: aggregate(value.failed_count)]

fetch cloud_dataproc_cluster
| metric 'dataproc.googleapis.com/cluster/job/submitted_count'
| align delta(1m)
| every 1m
| group_by [resource.project_id],
    [value_submitted_count_aggregate: aggregate(value.submitted_count)]

fetch cloud_dataproc_cluster
| metric 'dataproc.googleapis.com/cluster/job/completion_time'
| group_by sliding(1h), [d: aggregate(value.completion_time)]
| value add[f: scale(fraction_less_than_from(d, 120 's'), '1')]
| value [high_latency_count: (1 - f) * count_from(d)]
| group_by [resource.project_id],
    [high_latency_count_aggregate: aggregate(high_latency_count)]

text.content: [View Failed job logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query?query=resource.type%3D%22cloud_dataproc_cluster%22%0Aseverity%3DERROR%0A). You may also want to expand the time range for the logs.
